instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message:
boots into os- no chime
randomly logs out then freezes kb + tpad
screen doesn't turn off when lid is closed
shitty looking shmoo on left usb port 
multicoloured pads near <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>, <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message: yes I have, there was no apparent water damage, although i havent tried to run asd yet, so I will do that. I tell all my water damage customers 1-8 weeks and this guy called on day 7, so its sitting in the I'll get to it later pile

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message: asd fails, mux switching failed, didnt switch error, while switching to IG

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage
threads.message: Look closer for corrosion. Would assume around MUX and or GPU.
